Sure, here are a few more science-based tools and techniques that can be used to optimize different aspects of your life:

1. Time management: Establishing a daily routine and setting specific goals for yourself can help you to make the most of your time and increase productivity. One popular time management technique is the Pomodoro Technique, which consists of working for 25 minutes and then taking a 5-minute break.
2. Memory improvement: Techniques such as mnemonic devices, flashcards, and spaced repetition can help you to remember information more effectively.
3. Mindfulness: Mindfulness practices such as meditation and yoga can help to improve focus and concentration, and reduce stress and anxiety. Mindfulness can also help you to be more present in the moment and to be more aware of your thoughts and feelings.
4. Habit formation: Habits are powerful tools to change behavior, you can use habit forming techniques such as setting a specific goal, tracking your progress and rewarding yourself.
5. Self-compassion: Self-compassion practices such as self-kindness, common humanity and mindfulness can help you to be more compassionate with yourself and to be more resilient to stress and negative self-talk.
6. Positive psychology: Positive psychology is a branch of psychology that studies what makes life worth living. It emphasizes on the importance of positive emotions, strengths-based approach, and engagement in activities that give you a sense of purpose and meaning in life.
7. Self-regulation: Self-regulation is the ability to control your thoughts, emotions and behaviors, it can be improved through techniques such as cognitive restructuring, emotional regulation, and self-monitoring.
